summary: Recovery housing allows people recovering from addiction to alcohol or illicit drugs to live together in a safe, supportive, stable, and alcohol- and drug-free environment. However, there have been reports that some recovery housing owners are exploiting residents to profit from them—for example, by sending them to doctors who bill their insurance for extensive and unneeded drug testing and share insurance payments with the owners...
title: Substance Use Disorder: Information on Recovery Housing Prevalence, Selected States' Oversight, and Funding
